trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest"></xref> class adds an entry to the directory.

The request may be added to the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument> or it can be used as the parameter for <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.SendRequest%2A>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute[])"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest"></xref> class using the specified distinguished name and attributes.
The distinguishedName of the new object in the directory.
An array, of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> objects, that contains the attributes for this object.
This parameter may be `null`.
The constructor creates an instance of the class using the specified distinguishedName and the object class.
The value specified in the `objectClass` parameter is added to the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest.Attributes%2A> property.
This value can be modified after this constructor is called.
The distinguishedName of the new object in the directory.
The object class for this object.
If this parameter is `null`, an exception is thrown.
The objectClass parameter contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest.Attributes"></xref> property contains a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> of attribute-value pairs for the object.
This property cannot be set.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> of attribute-value pairs for the object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest.DistinguishedName"></xref> property contains the distinguished name of the object.
The distinguished name of the object.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AddRequest.ToXmlNode(System.Xml.XmlDocument)"></xref> method creates an XML node from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
The resulting <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object.
